page.title: 14CHANGING INDUSTRY
page.content: This area has had a long industrial history. At one time much of the area was covered with clay pits, kilns, drying sheds etc. The clay was used to make bricks and tiles - then the premier industry in Bridgwater. None of these works remain and the pits have mostly been infilled to provide land for a new series of industrial and commercial development. This includes warehousing, transport and machinery stores, timber merchants and small manufacturing units. The very last kiln in this area has survived. There are plans to restore it as a reminder of Bridgwater's industrial past. There is an extensive cattle market held each Wednesday. On sale there are sheep, lambs, steers, cows and calves. There is an abattoir on site which deals with some of the animals passing through the market.
